title: As much as CertainlyT does create balance problems and overloaded kits...
body:
We do have him to thank for a lot of stuff.  The fact of the matter is, he was the first designer to understand that a game with 120 champs (or however many there were around thresh/darius time), it was time for some innovation.  Did he go overboard (especially on kalista)?  Yes.  However, he has allowed other champion designers to look at his designs and think "huh, maybe that will create balance problems... but let's try some innovation!"  Without him, champions like bard who IMO is really cool design and is not imbalanced would not be possible.   I know, I know, we all hate kalista and it's fun to rag on him.  and hes pretty bad at balance (no offense, bro), but without him league would not be as poular nor as fun to play.  Sure, it's fun to reminisce about when every champion was simple and balancing wasnt hard, but let's be real:  do you really want a game with no fun/ unique champions even if it is better balanced?  I say no - the balance is an issue, and CT takes it too far sometimes, but he has evolved the game into something that it probably wouldn't be without his creativity and the precedents he set.

EDIT: Thanks for all the replies!  Couple of things i want to say:

#1 - I like that this is promoting healthy, non-circlejerky conversation where all posts are getting up/downvoted not like 30 with 100 upvotes and then like 2 with -20.

#2 - CT is not DIRECTLY responsible for really well designed champs like bard, but he was the first one to challenge what a moba should be in terms of simplicity.

seems to be a double-edged sword though, recently I feel the trend is to design patterns that are way too strong if they are executed perfectly (@Ekko-stun, windwall, kindred-stacking, GP-Kegs, Azir, Tahm, Morde-drake-snowballing...) - while still being strong/annoying when played sub-par. On the one hand this leads to a lot of old designs getting somewhat unviable (as they are just not as versatile, nor as strong when perferctly executed); on the other hand it also makes games very frustrating/binary if you run into someone that mastered those more gamechanging mechanics.

So, while I like to see some innovation - it just should not be at the cost of proper balance/meaningfull counterplay. Champs should be created with real weaknesses to make up for their strengths.

>Thresh is just Blitz 2.0

I think here is where i differ from most...i really like thresh, he has some good strengths and some good weaknesses (though right now he´s a tad weak). He´s vastly different from Blitz: Blitz is a really offense-focused Champ, while Thresh is mostly defense-oriented. you usually donßt peel with Blitz, but with thresh that´s the main thing you do.

>Yasuo is basically a mix of Akali/Katerina 

while i heavily reject the current version of Yasuo, that comparision really is lacking. his ult and windwall are fairly new concepts for lol and the champ overall could have worked out very well as a sort of bruiser (samurai usually did actually wear some actual armor and didn´t just run around in fancy cloth), focusing on disrupting the opponents with his knockups+ult+windwall instead of just onecritting them.
Same can be said about ekko unfortunatelly...but within the current settings of ADCs+peel killing everything the only way Riot seems to find to make melee-carries somewhat usable is to heavily overload their kits.

>Kalista

Well, she´s a mess - but still a unique one. Really put the cooperation of support and carry to another level of sorts (even if the ult in function is sort of a malph-ult lite + a ridiculous abusable getting out of jail card). Unfortuantelly she hadn´t been only balanced around the duo playing well together, but obviously had to be viable solo aswell - making her a menace for an incredible long time before tuning her down to the current level. And even so the passive remains one of the most annyoing things to ever be added to LoLs code.
(same for Tahm though, another Champ excelling at cooperation getting overtuned into a giant mess because people couldn´t work together asap + an incredible frustrating ability to save allies that had been clearly out of position)

>Morde

yea...well...the drake-thing is unique, but it´s also the most ridiculous thing to ever come up with in the first place. Again a Champ that theoretically would have serious weaknesses (being easy to kite/take down later on), but has a too strong success-case if he plays to his strengths (taking early drake with xp lead and snowballing it).

so while i don´t like a lot of CertainlyTs tunings...i like most of his basic/new mechanics - and the things i really dislike are unfortunatelly not unique for his designs, but for most of the recent releases (which might be indeed a case of power-creeping).
